author: Kristina Peterson
title: Congressional Chaplain’s Departure Sparks Backlash in the House
text:
WASHINGTON—House Speaker Paul Ryan faced a growing backlash Friday over his reasons for asking the Rev. Patrick Conroy, the House chaplain, to resign, as lawmakers’ questions over the personnel decision roiled the chamber.
A devout Catholic, Mr. Ryan had said early last week that Father Conroy, a Jesuit priest who was first unanimously elected the House’s 60th chaplain in May 2011, would step down next month. But many lawmakers hadn’t realized that Father Conroy wasn’t leaving his post voluntarily until news reports this...
